nodes.bodyText: The TODO here is for this PR right? :D

This is a weird interface; we don't need DirectoryLister as a param. Shouldn't we bind DirectoryLister to a concrete FS and avoid passing it in dynamically? DirectoryLister are fixed during config time.

It is little weird.
I started this with binding DirectoryLister to concrete FS directly, but it was more messy.
The main reason was that we don't create the FileSystem through Injections, hence for the FS to use DirectoryLister, it would need to be passed to constructor directory.
This creates weird flows, especially for FileSystemWrapper.
Please note that in this case DIrectoryLister is just a utility providing specific functionality such as Timeout and caching.

This is also a weird interface where the input is a iterator supplier and the output is the iterator.... I think both CachingDirectoryLister and TimeoutDirectoryLister should take a 'delegate" in their constructors rather than providing a supplier here. The supplier passed in from PrestoExtendedFileSystemWrapper or any other FS should create their own generic DirectoryLister.
The old logic is exactly like that, isn't it?

Yes the old logic was that. The reason this is different because the initiator here is the FS rather DirectoryLister.
The DirectoryLister is a utility which takes an iterator of HiveFileInfo and then depending on its own logic uses this input iterator supplier conditionally and return to the consumer.

The other way to clean this would be to have two list methods in the ExtendedFileSystem, or single one with a parameter to signal if the DirectoryLister should be used or not. Then it would look like following:
ExtendedFS::listwithDL => DirectoryLister::list => ExtendedFS::listwithoutDL
Maybe call it HadoopExtendedFileSystemr
We may still need the delegate model
In future yes, but not required for now.

I noticed that the SNAPSHOT version has been uploaded to the maven repository, hence using this temporarily to run tests. Once the hadoop-apache2 release issue is resolved, I would update it to use release version.

nodes.bodyText: DirectoryLister should belong to filesystem
Will remove the util package completely.

Inject DirectoryLister to each HdfsConfiguration impl (e.g., HiveCachingHdfsConfiguration). Then creating the ExtendedFileSystem with the injected DirectoryLister. That will avoid the param for this interface.
I thought we discussed about this. This approach results in to lot of mess. Please remember we need the DirectoryLister for HadoopExtendedFileSystem as well.
I haven't compiled or tested yet. But do you think this would work: highker@8784c41 ?

It would work. I had started with this approach only.  However I don't like the idea of HdfsEnvironment and PrestoExtendedFileSystemCache dealing with DirectoryLister. It makes Directory lister sit at the core. Also with this too many components, who have nothing to do with list interface, deals with directorylister.

That is fine. Having the dirty implementation is better than a confusing interface IMHO. Also, given DirectoryLister is already in presto-hive-common (which I'm not a big fan frankly), we have already put DirectoryLister as a first-class citizen. If there is a way to avoid that, it might be fine with other approaches.
James and I discussed and we agreed to switch the list interface to the older way. Basically relying on the directorylister for list functionality.
What's this?
It's a method used in the tempfs.

Is it a common interface or something really specific to one FS? If it is the latter case, it is better not to open a backdoor at the interface only to tunnel through the functionality for that specific impl.
The interface seems generic enough to me, however at present it is only supported by one FS. I am okay with either.
How about internal tempfs implementing listFiles/listDirectory using listByPrefix? listByPrefix is tempfs's version of list because there is no directory concept there.
@shixuan-fan  Not sure, if I follow. Are you saying to use listFiles/listDirectory as the interface for listByPrefix for the tempfs?
I have removed this interface.

@shixuan-fan Not sure, if I follow. Are you saying to use listFiles/listDirectory as the interface for listByPrefix for the tempfs?

Yeah exactly :D
Remove default behavior
Why?
It forces each impl to have this method implemented; unless the default behavior is frequently reused.
All the default implemented are used in most FS, some e.g. list used in almost all.
util packages are mostly for static helper functions; this belongs to filesystem

nodes.bodyText: Remove Wrapper
You don't need to move DirectoryLister to presto-hive-common, right? Just keep it in presto-hive.

Yeah, most of the refactoring came because of directorylister changes.
However the reason I didn't move back, because our initial idea was to keep most of the common models to hive-common.
presto-hive-common will become too thick. Let's only move necessary classes to this module. DirectoryLister can now live in presto-hive
ok.
